article.title: Boiled_leather
article.paragraph: Boiled leather, sometimes calledcuir bouilli, was a historical construction material forarmour. It consists of thickleather, boiled in water. According to some sources boiledCooking oiloilandwaxwere used as well, while others posit the use ofammoniafrom fermented animalurine. The boiling causes the leather to become harder but also more brittle. The boiled leather can be fashioned into lames orScale armourscalesto makelamellar armourlamellarorscale armor. The leather remains flexible for a short time after boiling, allowing it to be molded into larger plates.
Cuir bouilli has also been employed tobookbindingbind books.
